definition: public/collectively owned/common/international (e.g. high seas, metric system, calendar)/make public/fair/just/Duke, highest of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/honorable (gentlemen)/father-in-law/male (animal)
Dagong Bao, popular newspaper name/Ta Kung Pao, newspaper founded 1902 in Beijing, now published in Hong Kong
to use public office to avenge private wrongs

sentences.english: S. joint communiques and the fundamental norms governing international relations.
sentences.chinese: 它违背《中美三个联合公报》和基本的国际关系准则。

sentences.english: She did not attend the hearing and was not represented in court.
sentences.chinese: 她没有出席法院和参加听证会，也未能向公报发言。

sentences.english: It is the best to classify the patent document into the technology field. That the patent document is not classified is practicable.
sentences.chinese: 而专利公报与专利索引宜入技术领域或干脆不分类。

sentences.english: It's the harsh truth where Cancún communiques fall silent.
sentences.chinese: 残酷的事实是坎昆公报停滞了这件事。

sentences.english: Includes six supplements, monthly newsletters , and two bulletins per year.
sentences.chinese: 每年含六次补编，每月简报和两份公报。

sentences.english: By the spring of1972, the Sino-American Shanghai Communique had been signed.
sentences.chinese: 到了1972年春天，签订了中美上海公报。

sentences.english: We will issue the statement at an appropriate time. Please keep a close watch.
sentences.chinese: 这一公报会适时发表，请大家及时跟踪。

sentences.english: The joint communiqué between the two countries was notified in the newspapers and over the radio.
sentences.chinese: 两国发表的联合公报已在各大报刊并以广播形式公布。

sentences.english: The two countries also released a joint communiqué.
sentences.chinese: 两国还发表了联合公报。

sentences.english: The three Sino-US Joint Communiques were signed in Shanghai in 1972.
sentences.chinese: 中美三个联合公报于1972年在上海签订。

sentences.english: Legal orders shall be promulgated by way of publication in government gazettes or newspapers.
sentences.chinese: 法规命令之发布，应刊登政府公报或新闻纸。

sentences.english: Yang Jinwei see Quebec accounted for lynching, grim-faced trying to explain.
sentences.chinese: 杨晋纬见张占魁公报私仇，气得面色铁青极力解释。

sentences.english: I caught the news bulletin on the radio.
sentences.chinese: 我从收音机里听到了那新闻公报。

sentences.english: A joint communique of truce was issued on June 5 that year.
sentences.chinese: 一份休战的联合公报在那年6月5日发表。

sentences.english: You ever look in the course bulletin?
sentences.chinese: 你们看到课程公报了吗？

definition: to inform/to report/to make known/report/speech/talk/lecture/CL:篇[pian1],份[fen4],個|个[ge4],通[tong4]
António Guterres (1949-), secretary-general of the United Nations (2017-), prime minister of Portugal (1995-2002)
